docs.snippet: Italy named former Juventus coach Antonio Conte as their manager on Thursday, replacing Cesare Prandelli who quit after the team's failure at this year's World Cup in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy named former Juventus coach Antonio Conte as their manager on Thursday, replacing Cesare Prandelli who quit after the team's failure at this year's World Cup in Brazil.

docs.snippet: Colombia's President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday he supported the use of marijuana for medical use as a means to ease the suffering of terminally ill patients and deprive criminals of profits from the illegal trade in the drug.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia's President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday he supported the use of marijuana for medical use as a means to ease the suffering of terminally ill patients and deprive criminals of profits from the illegal trade in the drug.

headline.main: Colombia's Santos Says Backs Marijuana Use for Medical Purposes
headline.print_headline: Colombia's Santos Says Backs Marijuana Use for Medical Purposes

docs.snippet: President Juan Manuel Santos on Thursday endorsed newly introduced legislation that would legalize marijuana for medicinal and therapeutic use in this drug war-afflicted Andean nation.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan Manuel Santos on Thursday endorsed newly introduced legislation that would legalize marijuana for medicinal and therapeutic use in this drug war-afflicted Andean nation.

headline.main: Santos Endorses Medical Marijuana for Colombia
headline.print_headline: Santos Endorses Medical Marijuana for Colombia

docs.snippet: Unloved even in their own country, Italy's national team clearly need a radical overhaul and, if anyone can do it, then it is the steely-willed Antonio Conte who was named as their new coach on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unloved even in their own country, Italy's national team clearly need a radical overhaul and, if anyone can do it, then it is the steely-willed Antonio Conte who was named as their new coach on Thursday.

headline.main: Plenty of Challenges for Conte With Italy
headline.print_headline: Plenty of Challenges for Conte With Italy

docs.snippet: Suárez, a striker from Uruguay, must serve the rest of his four-month ban for biting an opponent at the World Cup, but he will be allowed to practice with his club team, Barcelona, and attend games.
docs.lead_paragraph: Suárez, a striker from Uruguay, must serve the rest of his four-month ban for biting an opponent at the World Cup, but he will be allowed to practice with his club team, Barcelona, and attend games.
docs.abstract: Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds Luis Suarez's four-month ban from soccer for biting an opponent at the World Cup, but allows him to practice with his club team Barcelona, and attend games.

headline.main: Luis Suárez’s Ban for Bite Is Altered but Upheld
headline.print_headline: Suárez’s Ban for Bite Is Altered but Upheld

docs.snippet: Uruguayan officials say a Nigerian man seeking to migrate to the United States wound up in the South American nation instead.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguayan officials say a Nigerian man seeking to migrate to the United States wound up in the South American nation instead.

headline.main: Migrant Arrives in Uruguay Thinking He Got to US
headline.print_headline: Migrant Arrives in Uruguay Thinking He Got to US

docs.snippet: South Korea winger Son Heung-min, who was denied permission to play at the Asian Games in September by his German club Bayer Leverkusen, has been named in the full national squad for upcoming friendlies against Venezuela and Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea winger Son Heung-min, who was denied permission to play at the Asian Games in September by his German club Bayer Leverkusen, has been named in the full national squad for upcoming friendlies against Venezuela and Uruguay.

headline.main: South Korea's Son Set to Return for September Friendlies
headline.print_headline: South Korea's Son Set to Return for September Friendlies

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez is ready to put his biting days behind him.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez is ready to put his biting days behind him.

headline.main: Suarez Pledges to Not Bite Again With Barcelona
headline.print_headline: Suarez Pledges to Not Bite Again With Barcelona

docs.snippet: Controversial striker Luis Suarez said he was "very depressed" after the World Cup biting incident that led to the Uruguay international being initially banned from all soccer activities for four months.
docs.lead_paragraph: Controversial striker Luis Suarez said he was "very depressed" after the World Cup biting incident that led to the Uruguay international being initially banned from all soccer activities for four months.

headline.main: Suarez Was 'Very Depressed' After Biting Incident
headline.print_headline: Suarez Was 'Very Depressed' After Biting Incident

docs.snippet: New Italy coach Antonio Conte brushed aside controversy over his wages, which will be part funded by the national federation's sponsors, when he was officially presented on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: New Italy coach Antonio Conte brushed aside controversy over his wages, which will be part funded by the national federation's sponsors, when he was officially presented on Tuesday.

headline.main: New Italy Coach Conte Shrugs Off Wages Controversy
headline.print_headline: New Italy Coach Conte Shrugs Off Wages Controversy
